parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To put on, clothe (another). From en and duno; to invest with clothing.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To renew, make new again. From ana and a derivative of kainos; to renovate.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From epiginosko; recognition, i.e. full discernment, acknowledgement.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
An image, likeness, bust. From eiko; a likeness, i.e. statue, profile, or representation, resemblance.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To create, form, shape, make, always of God. Probably akin to ktaomai; to fabricate, i.e. Found.
